instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> throttling
threads.message:
Hello, i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that throttles very fast. I compared it to another Mac with the exact same specs and it throttles to about 30% of CPU capacity in matter of minutes while the other one lasts hours and only gets to about 70% throttle.

I changed thermal paste, changed the copper plate, tried with an external OS. The battery works fine, adapter is 87w OEM. There are no other software running in the background. Fans run at max.

All temperature sensors are all right except for the CPU ones which go for about 90 C

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> throttling
threads.message: I noticed the touchbar wasnt working. <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_DFR</SIGNAL> was shorted to ground by <CAPACITOR>C4471</CAPACITOR>. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C4471</CAPACITOR> and now the mac doesnt seem to be throttling anymore but the touchbar still doesnt work (tried known working one). <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW_DFR</SIGNAL> is pulsing from 0.4v to 1.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> throttling
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is stable?
Just in case, change <CHIP>U4404</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> throttling
threads.message:
Now i have stable <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0SW</SIGNAL>, but still no touchbar. 

i get <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_T139</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_DFR</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> throttling
threads.message: Compare J4401/2 readings in diode mode and voltage with good board.
